The Earnings Pop brought the share price up to 610, just 4 points above where Aapl is now. Perhaps the year ago Quarter was an exception to that. Volume is the key here. IMO, Aapl needs to state the Ex-Divvy date at the Earnings call. Why ? To allow the Funds to begin to buy, who have not been allowed to buy Aapl due to their Charters. I have spoken of this before, and believe this to be. It will unleash a tide so fast, nothing we have seen yet. Fasten your seat belts. Those triggers are all set and ready, and it will be fast. I think MM will hold this stock back (sideways) the next few days. Thanks for your response.

Topic.Title: A Moment for Silence and Pray

Message.Msg: Come on....give us all a break. Anyone with half a brain knows the Independent APPLE Analysts are the most accurate. Wall Street Analyst Sacconaghi will be wrong. His prediction is just a "shill" so that his string-pullers can BUY MORE AAPL. Independent Analyst Horace Dediu has predicted $11.54 EPS. I believe that APPLE will "beat" company guidance of $8.68 by a range of 30% to 40% - equating to an actual between $11.28 to $12.15 respectively. Since the Wall Street Consensus is ONLY $10.35 EPS, it looks crystal clear that APPLE will deliver another strong "beat". See the track record below.... APPLE “BEATS” COMPANY GUIDANCE OF EPS CONSISTENTLY: APPLE INC. delivered a massive “beat” for their Fiscal Q2 Earnings Report. APPLE INC. "beat" their company guidance by 44.7% - near the high end of the historical 1-1/2 year prior range! (see below) APPLE "BEATS" their own Company Guidance consistently as follows: 2010 Q1 Guidance = $4.80; Actual = $6.43;(Beat=40.0%) 2011 Q2 Guidance = $4.90; Actual = $6.40; (Beat=30.6%) 2011 Q3 Guidance = $5.07; Actual = $7.79; (Beat=53.6%) 2011 Q4 Guidance = $5.50; Actual = $7.05 (Beat=28.2%) 2012 Q1 Guidance = $9.30; Actual = $13.87 (Beat=49.1%) 2012 Q2 Guidance = $8.50; Actual = $12.30 (Beat=44.7%) Given: APPLE’s EPS Company Guidance is $8.68 for This Quarter ( Fiscal Q3 Ending June 30, 2012) – to be reported on July 24, 2012. If APPLE “beats” their Guidance by only 30% (Equating to an actual EPS of $11.28), then TTM EPS = $44.55… 15 PE = $668.25/sh.; 16 PE = $712.80/sh.; 17 PE = $757.35/sh.; 18 PE = $801.90/sh.; 19 PE = $846.45/sh.; 20 PE = $891.00/sh. If APPLE “beats” their Guidance by 40% (Equating to an actual EPS of $12.15), then TTM EPS = $45.42… 15 PE = $681.30/sh.; 16 PE = $726.72/sh.; 17 PE = $772.14/sh.; 18 PE = $817.56/sh.; 19 PE = $862.98/sh.; 20 PE = $908.40/sh. INVEST in APPLE INC. ("AAPL") for Value, Growth & Income (Dividend Announcement likely on next Tuesday) P.S. - The $10 Billion Share Buyback Program has been authorized. I hope the Administrator of APPLE's buyback program has the Call Option Sellers (manipulators) in their bull's eye sights. The end-game is near for this pack of $cum. I predict the AAPL share price will be less volatile, at least to the downside, going forward.

Topic.Title: Morgan Stanley analyst Katy Apple financial results to ‘disappoint’

Message.Msg: interesting thing about all the mac negativeness and how these "pro analyst" keep reiterating how they will be down seq qtr to qtr. last qtr us mac sales were calculated at 1.6m by gartner where worldwide sales ended up being 4m. this qtr, gartner calculated 1.9m. if you extrapolate, that suggest ~4.8m worldwide sales this qtr. what is also interesting is that apple guidance was up this quarter (34b rev, 8.68 eps) vs last qtr (32.5b rev, 8.50 eps) with over 3 wks of known info into the qtr. anything is possible with what is going on around the world, but all this strongly suggest that the independents will likely much more correct than the so-called pros... again.

Topic.Title: Andy Zaky outlook

Message.Msg: here is what Andy Zaky had to say: "After speaking with them, I think this could potentially be a blowout quarter. The most recent blowout quarters we've seen in Apple took place in fiscal Q1 2012, fiscal Q3 2011 and fiscal Q2 2010. So they don't happen THAT often. I think this quarter makes for a good set-up. "In fact, I don't think I have felt more confident in how Apple is going to respond to earnings almost regardless of what it reports this quarter. Apple is almost certainly going to gap-up on earnings. I know the trading action is weak right now, but that is a major red herring. "I couldn't be anymore confident in how the stock will react on earnings. That's because Apple has gapped-up in 20 out of the last 26 earnings reports. Three of the failures happened in Q1 2006, 2007, and 2008 when Apple had a consistent trend of selling off on Q1 earnings. The other three failures had some major extenuating circumstances. First we have two back to back sell-offs in Q4 2010 and Q4 2011. One was the result of Apple being extremely overbought (Q2 2010) and the other was the result of Apple missing. The 6th sell-off happened in Q3 2008 which was the result of Apple reporting in a very poor market environment. So even if you don't discount or explain those six times Apple has sold-off on earnings (three of which happened ages ago) the fact of the matter is, Apple gaps-up 80% of the time. [See chart below the fold.] "So I think market participants really need to be thinking twice about selling into earnings right now. As investor will soon find out, that will be a major mistake this quarter. If you sell ahead of the results, you will likely miss a major gap-up on earnings."

Message.Title: beat or miss, who cares?
Message.Msg: we know it's going to $1000 eventually.

Topic.Title: Andy Zaky outlook

Message.Msg: Wow, that is quite amazing. I met Andy some time agp at a seminar here in Los Angeles and found him to be a modest and congenial chap. Very little bluster or bravado if any. So if a quality guy like that, with his outstanding record of issuing AAPL buy recommendations, is this enthusiastic about Tuesday's announcement of operating results, I am somewhat reassured. I see Apple as a value play primarily, so am not concerned about day to day or weekly fluctuations in the share price. There is a baseline valuation according to my criteria (metrics) which suggests that at $600. per share the stock sells at a very reasonable 10.7X fiscal 2013 EPS of 56.00, and ex cash that number (projected) is 8.2X the 56.00 number. And remember, Apple's fiscal year begins in only 49 more trading sessions. Just too much going on at Apple not to be super confident about a one year price objective in the 720-740 range. Rest assured about this, please. So keep your eye on the ball no matter what happens Tuesday. Welcome a downdraft in the shares because it could be our last chance to position AAPL at these ridiculously low numbers. Big J in L.A., retired security analyst (The Foristall Co., member The Los Angeles Society of Security Analysts).

Message.Title: Here is what will happen before earnings and after earnings. My trade.
Message.Msg: I believe we got our movement from $550's to above $600 this last few weeks. The premium of this weekly options are high. Apple will trade in a tight range of $10 before earnings. Apple will beat and the stock will rise in after hours. Those smart to catch the $20-$30 point rise will sell after hours to lock in their gains. By opening bell the next day Apple will only be up half and by end of the day Apple will be up $5-$10 dollars. If you own options sell at open. Guidance will seem weak and the time to buy puts will be at open. The smart money or big money will short into after hours earnings pop; selling all they can. The next few weeks Apple will start to trade down to low $500's. Apple iphone 5 is expected to be released in October. Pre orders may begin as early at August. No reason to buy until then. 1. If you must trade earnings with options buy in the money calls. Quick trade. 2. If you own stock sell the out of the money calls for August. Apple will reach top and trade down until August/ September. Free money! 3. If you are a smart trader wait until after earnings and buy puts on pop. If Apple sells off sooner than later follow the trend down. 4. If you a really smart trader opt out and wait until all new products come out. Next Feb. - April Apple will go up $200-$300 dollars on new product/earnings cycle. I made all my money then and plan to go all in then. Remember get a plummel and make some money!

Message.Title: Google admits failure in copying iOS, excuses its patent infringement with Communist rhetoric
Message.Msg: July 21st, 2012 Daniel Eran Dilger Google has has issued its latest defense for having appropriated Apple’s intellectual property: an argument that insists some inventions are so good that they should be wrenched from their patent holders by the government and distributed to the proletariat of Android licensees so that Google can make unfettered money selling ads on its stolen platform. . . After an initial attempt to insist that other company’s patents and other intellectual property simply don’t exist and can be infringed upon without limit, Google next embarked upon a multibillion dollar effort to assemble its own patent portfolio, including the $12 billion purchase of Motorola Mobility, a sale that was expressly made to obtain its patents. Google has since perpetuated Motorola’s own offensive patent attacks against competitors, seeking not just injunctions but injunctions based on Standards Essential Patents, a particular subset of patents that have already been dedicated to special Fair, Reasonable and NonDiscriminatory licensing terms by their holders. This, in itself, was such a brazenly hypocritical action that it should have gotten Google booed off the stage, or at least seated at the children’s table next to other egregiously notorious patent trolls Proview and Lodsys. Google is actually worse than the run of the mill patent trolls because it constantly whines about freedom, openness and the threat of patent abuse. That is, until it gets its first opportunity to abuse patents itself. Google is now backing up for more public defecation on its reputation. What could be more hypocritical than arguing two sides of an argument at the same time? On one hand, Google is insisting on the right to demand outrageous fees from Microsoft over patents essential to H.264. Remember when this shameless company was grandstanding about how H.264 was bad for the web because it involved patent licensing under FRAND? Now that Google owns some H.264 patents, it’s proving itself the main abuser–if not the only major abuser–of H.264 FRAND patents. What a shameful bag of #$%$

Topic.Title: Morgan Stanley analyst Katy Apple financial results to ‘disappoint’

Message.Msg: The indies are typically not making their living selling advice. They are simply trying to be as accurate as possible. The pros have more at stake; if they overestimate on a company's earnings and their customers go into the stock and get burned, those customers might go somewhere else. So I'll trust the indies more and myself the most. I have my own estimates that are conservative but still result in a beat of the consensus estimates.

Topic.Title: Andy Zaky outlook

Message.Msg: One other point I would like to make. Everyone asks: why the discrepancy between the sell-side analysts' consensus EPS estimates and that of the better bloggers and independent gurus. Are the analysts just plain dumb? No, not at all! Having been a security analyst I can give an insight to this situation. In the case of Apple currently, over 97% of the analysts are bullish with either buy or strong buy recommendations. They want Apple stock to go up, right? So they tend to low-ball their estimates to make the company look good when beating the analyst's number. And they all do this on a consistent basis, hence the difference in these two consensus figures. As we know only rarely (and with very good reason) does Apple ever "miss" beating the consensus estimate.
What was the reverse split all about...last year, right ?
